intro: Bonnaya trichotoma, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, hairy, ovate leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to dry and sandy soils, often found in savanna and woodland areas. The plant is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine.
